alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 10:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND EAST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM MDT... At 1009 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rowe, or 18 miles southeast of Santa Fe, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Upper Colonias, Rowe, Glorieta, South San Ysidro and Lower Colonias. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 294 and 316. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Santa Fe Metro Area
